    • Exploring probability distributions for bivariate temporal granularities

Build dynamic temporal granularities

Source: R/create_gran.R
create_gran.Rd

Build dynamic temporal granularities

create_gran(.data, gran1 = NULL, hierarchy_tbl = NULL, label = TRUE,
  abbr = TRUE, ...)

Arguments

.data

A tsibble object.
gran1

the granularity to be created. For temporal data, any combination of "second", "minute", "qhour", "hhour", "hour", "day", "week", "fortnight ,"month", "quarter", "semester" or "year" can be chosen in the form of finer to coarser unit. For example, for the granularity hour of the week, value is "hour_week".
hierarchy_tbl

A hierarchy table specifying the hierarchy of units and their relationships
label

Logical. TRUE will display the month as an ordered factor of character string such as "January", "February". FALSE will display the month as an ordered factor such as 1 to 12, where 1 stands for January and 12 for December.
abbr

logical. FALSE will display abbreviated labels
...

Other arguments passed on to individual methods.

Value

A tsibble with an additional column of granularity

Examples


# Search for granularities
smart_meter10 %>%
  search_gran(highest_unit = "week")
#> [1] "hhour_hour" "hhour_day"  "hhour_week" "hour_day"   "hour_week" 
#> [6] "day_week"  

# Screen harmonies from the search list

smart_meter10 %>%
  harmony(
    ugran = "day",
    filter_in = "wknd_wday"
  )
#> # A tibble: 7 x 4
#>   facet_variable x_variable facet_levels x_levels
#>   <chr>          <chr>             <int>    <int>
#> 1 hour_day       hhour_hour           24        2
#> 2 wknd_wday      hhour_hour            2        2
#> 3 wknd_wday      hhour_day             2       48
#> 4 hhour_hour     hour_day              2       24
#> 5 wknd_wday      hour_day              2       24
#> 6 hhour_hour     wknd_wday             2        2
#> 7 hour_day       wknd_wday            24        2

# visualize probability distribution of
# the harmony pair (wknd_wday, hour_day)
smart_meter10 %>%
  prob_plot(
    gran1 = "wknd_wday",
    gran2 = "hour_day",
    response = "general_supply_kwh",
    plot_type = "quantile",
    quantile_prob = c(0.1, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.9)
  ) +
  scale_y_sqrt()

# Compute granularities for non-temporal data

cricket_tsibble <- cricket %>%
  mutate(data_index = row_number()) %>%
  as_tsibble(index = data_index)
#> Warning: Calling `row_number()` without importing or prefixing it is deprecated, use `dplyr::row_number()`.
#> This warning is displayed once per session.

hierarchy_model <- tibble::tibble(
  units = c("index", "ball", "over", "inning", "match"),
  convert_fct = c(1, 6, 20, 2, 1)
)
cricket_tsibble %>%
  create_gran(
    "ball_over",
    hierarchy_model
  )
#> # A tsibble: 51,360 x 12 [1]
#>    season match_id inning batting_team bowling_team ball_per_over  over winner
#>     <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>        <chr>                <int> <dbl> <chr> 
#>  1   2008        2      1 Chennai Sup… Kings XI Pu…             1     1 Chenn…
#>  2   2008        2      1 Chennai Sup… Kings XI Pu…             2     1 Chenn…
#>  3   2008        2      1 Chennai Sup… Kings XI Pu…             3     1 Chenn…
#>  4   2008        2      1 Chennai Sup… Kings XI Pu…             4     1 Chenn…
#>  5   2008        2      1 Chennai Sup… Kings XI Pu…             5     1 Chenn…
#>  6   2008        2      1 Chennai Sup… Kings XI Pu…             6     1 Chenn…
#>  7   2008        2      1 Chennai Sup… Kings XI Pu…             1     2 Chenn…
#>  8   2008        2      1 Chennai Sup… Kings XI Pu…             2     2 Chenn…
#>  9   2008        2      1 Chennai Sup… Kings XI Pu…             3     2 Chenn…
#> 10   2008        2      1 Chennai Sup… Kings XI Pu…             4     2 Chenn…
#> # … with 51,350 more rows, and 4 more variables: dismissal_kind <chr>,
#> #   total_runs <dbl>, data_index <int>, ball_over <fct>

# Validate if given column in the data set
# equals computed granularity
validate_gran(cricket_tsibble,
  gran = "over_inning",
  hierarchy_tbl = hierarchy_model,
  validate_col = "over"
)
#> [1] TRUE
